subject: Re: [junit] test case names
msgSnippet: I would recommend using JUnit-addons flexible Test Runner, then adding a listener that does the logging. Vladimir can confirm this as a good approach. ... J.
messageBody:
I would recommend using JUnit-addons' flexible Test Runner, then adding a listener that does the logging. Vladimir can confirm this as a good approach.

>So said Jeegar Shah on 2003-07-18 --------------------
>What i need is to output the names of all test case running in the suite
>and display which is executing currently when i see console.
>I'm using log4j for logging so i'll be logging the test method name in
>log4j.
>I was hoping there must be some direct way juint can log it for you in
>log4j.
>
>"J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
>>So said Jeegar Shah on 2003-07-16 --------------------
>>Is there any way Junit can print out name of the test case its
>>executing ?
>
>If you need it in an emergency, I recommend this:
>
>protected void setUp() {
> System.out.println(getName());
>}
>
>If you need something more permanent, then it depends on your needs.
>
>Do you need to see the test name during execution or in a report?
>
>
>J. B. Rainsberger,
>President, Diaspar Software Services
>Let's write software that people understand.
